intro: Brassavola digbyana var. fimbripetala, commonly known as the Fimbriate Night Orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. The orchid's unique floral structure and nocturnal flowering pattern make it a notable species in botanical studies.
